CSS_counter-style.summary: The _counter-style CSS at-rule lets you extend predefined list styles and define your own counter styles that are not part of the predefined set of styles. The _counter-style rule contains descriptors defining how the counter value is converted into a string representation.

remarks.para: While CSS provides many useful predefined counter styles, the _counter-style at-rule offers an open-ended method for creating counters. This at-rule caters to the needs of worldwide typography by allowing authors to define their own counter styles when the predefined styles don't fit their requirements.
